headline: NEWS ALERT: Trump plans to endorse candidate in contentious Ohio Senate GOP primary, report says

Trump’s ‘Save America’ rally in Ohio is scheduled for April 23.

The article goes on to state the following:
During his campaign, Vance touted an endorsement from Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia, a close ally of Trump who joined Vance on the campaign trail, in what was seen as a move to persuade Trump to back his candidacy.

As the most reliable and balanced news aggregation service on the internet, DML News App offers the following information published by WashingtonExaminer:
Former President Donald Trump is planning to endorse author J.D.

— Washington Examiner (@dcexaminer) April 14, 2022

Additionally, Vance’s lackluster polling numbers recently presented “a major worry for Trump who doesn’t want to waste his endorsement,” the report adds.
Vance, like all the candidates in the field, has openly courted Trump’s endorsement as a means of differentiating himself from the rest of the field.
According to the report, Trump has expressed concern about Vance in the passed, citing criticisms of him while running for president back in 2016.
Former President Donald Trump is planning to endorse author @JDVance1 in Ohio’s crowded and contentious Republican Senate primary.
And if you have the DML NEWS APP, please tell people to download it today and help conservatives have a real voice.

Promoted Content
NBC News reported that Trump is planning to endorse Vance, citing three sources with knowledge.
